intro: Henckelia wijesundarae, commonly known as the Sri Lankan starflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine pubescence, while its flowers display a striking combination of white and purple hues. Due to habitat loss, Henckelia wijesundarae is considered critically endangered and is of significant botanical interest.
